articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Israeli forces have ended combat operations in the Jabalia area of north Gaza after destroying more than 10 kilometres of tunnels during days of intense fighting that included over 200 air strikes, the military said on Friday.
articles.title: Israeli military says combat in part of north Gaza is over

articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko
articles.description: Outgunned and outmanned, Kyiv has been increasing pressure on its Western allies to be able to launch offensive strikes at military targets inside Russia.
articles.title: Ukraine using Western arms to strike inside Russia 'a question of time', says Zelenskiy

articles.author: Bate Felix, Alexander Winning
articles.description: South African political parties geared up for coalition talks on Friday as the governing African National Congress (ANC) looked set to fall well short of a majority in this week's election, the first time this has happened in 30 years of democracy.
articles.title: South Africa heads for coalition as ANC set for big fall

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Chinese Vice Foreign Minister Ma Zhaoxu urged the United States to refrain from "smearing" China and to stop imposing "abusive" sanctions on Chinese companies at talks this week in Washington, China's foreign ministry said on Friday.
articles.title: Chinese vice foreign minister urged US to stop 'smearing' China, Beijing says

articles.author: Sabine Siebold, Jan Lopatka, Jason Hovet
articles.description: NATO chief Jens Stoltenberg on Friday dismissed warnings by Russian President Vladimir Putin that allowing Kyiv to use Western weapons for strikes inside Russian territory might lead to an escalation.
articles.title: NATO chief dismisses Russian warnings after lifting of arms restrictions

articles.author: Jatindra Dash
articles.description: At least 33 people, including election officials on duty, died of suspected heatstroke in India's states of Bihar, Uttar Pradesh and Odisha on Friday, and the heatwave in the region is expected to continue until Saturday, authorities said.
articles.title: India heatwave kills at least 33, including election officials

articles.author: Thomas Escritt
articles.description: German police said they shot and wounded a man armed with a knife who attacked a right-wing demonstration in the southwestern city of Mannheim on Friday.
articles.title: German police shoot knifeman who attacked far-right rally

articles.author: Layli Foroudi
articles.description: A Paris-based Moroccan journalist who wears the hijab said on Friday she was appealing against a rule that bans women from covering their head in photos on the French press ID card.
articles.title: Journalist challenges rule banning hijab in French press card photos

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: El Salvador's national police shared details on Tuesday about an alleged plot by veterans of the country's civil war to detonate explosives on Saturday, when President Nayib Bukele is inaugurated for a second term.
articles.title: El Salvador inauguration bomb plot foiled, police say

articles.author: Camillus Eboh
articles.description: Nigeria's main labour unions on Friday said they had declared an indefinite strike from Monday over the minimum wage.
articles.title: Nigeria's main labour unions declare indefinite strike over minimum wage
